intro: Scrophularia fontqueri, commonly known as the Sierra Madre scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Scrophularia fontqueri is part of the Plantaginaceae family and is known for its adaptability to arid and semi-arid environments.
